revision.comment: Created page with "==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherw..."
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. * Metaphor names should be in all caps
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on category=Metaphor}} The list of metaphors is now found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.

revision.comment: moved [[Metaphor Repository (Persian)]] to [[Metaphor Wiki (Persian)]]
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. * Metaphor names should be in all caps
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on category=Metaphor}} The list of metaphors is now found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.

revision.comment: /* Metaphor Data Guide */
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. * Metaphor names should be in all caps
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on category=Metaphor}} The list of metaphors is now found here: [[:Category:Metaphor|Metaphors]]. A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.

revision.text:

A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler

[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]

==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. .
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on category=Metaphor}} : [[:Category:Metaphor| ]]. : [[ ]] --> Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[:Category:Frame|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]]

revision.comment: /* Metaphor Data Guide */
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. .
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on namespace=Metaphor|namespace=Metaphor}} : [[List of all Metaphors| ]]. : [[ ]] The list of linguistic metaphors can be found here: [[:Category:Linguistic metaphor|Linguistic Metaphors]] Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[List of all Frames|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]]. Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Level | Metaphor Level]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Type | Metaphor Type]]
[[Property:Inference | Metaphor Inference]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Source frame | Source Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Target frame | Target Domain]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Alias.Provenance | Provenance]]
[[Property:Status | Status]]
[[Property:Entered by | Entered by]]
[[Property:Last reviewed by | Last Reviewed]]
[[Property:Mapping | Mappings]]
==Metaphor Standards== Refer to the [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Standards Standards page] for guides on capitalization, citation, and so on.

revision.comment: /* Metaphor Data Guide */
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. .

These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]

revision.comment: /* Metaphor Data Guide */
revision.text:
==Metaphor Data Guide== To edit a metaphor or create a new metaphor, type its name in the box below. If the metaphor already exists, you will be taken to its edit page, otherwise, you can create it from scratch. .
{{#forminput:form=Metaphor|link text= New Metaphor|button text=Create/Edit Metaphor|autocomplete on namespace=Metaphor|namespace=Metaphor}} : [[List of all Metaphors| ]]. : [[ ]] The list of linguistic metaphors can be found here: [[:Category:Linguistic metaphor|Linguistic Metaphors]] A list of metaphor families can be found here: [[Metaphor Families]]. Metaphors listed by type: [[Metaphors by Type]] The list of frames can be found here: [[List of all Frames|Frames]]. A list of frame families can be found here: [[Frame Families]] ([[Detailed Frame Families|with LUs]]). Frames divided into Cogs and Frames can be found here: [[Cogs and Frames]] A graph of relations between all the metaphors in the repository is here: [[Map of all metaphors]] ==Metaphor Summary Pages== These are pages put together to allow for the browsing of metaphors according to useful descriptive categories. * [[Metaphors that participate in transitive chains]] * [[Metaphors listed by status]] * [[Metaphors with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors indexed by aliases]] * [[Frames listed by status]] * [[Frames with missing fields]] * [[Metaphors that need fixing]] * [[Frames that need fixing]] * [[Metaphor Lists for Status Reports]] ==Metaphor Glossary and Property Guide== The glossary, which provides definitions for terms common to conceptual metaphor theory and/or this wiki, is located here: [http://metaphor.icsi.berkeley.edu/metaphor/index.php/Glossary Glossary]. These are the properties that are used to describe a metaphor. You can click on any of the properties to get a better description of its intended filler
[[Property:Related metaphor| Metaphor Relations]]
[[Property:Metaphor.Experiential basis | Experiential Basis of Metaphor]]
